content: Act as a helpful AI assistant

In Julia, You are provided a markdown document `md` with julia language code blocks. Write a function `extract_julia_code` that extracts all the code blocks, removes code fences and joins the code blocks (if there are multiple) together with a newline. Return a String. Do not provide any examples.

```julia
function extract_julia_code(md::String)
    # Regular expression to match Julia code blocks
    re = r"```julia([^`]*)```"ms
    
    # Initialize an empty string to store the extracted code
    extracted_code = ""
    
    # Loop through each match of the regular expression
    for m in eachmatch(re, md)
        # Get the text inside the code fence
        code_text = m.captures[1]
        
        # Remove leading and trailing whitespace from the code text
        clean_code_text = strip(code_text)
        
        # If there's no code, skip this match
        if clean_code_text == ""
            continue
        end
        
        # Append the code to the extracted code string with a newline
        extracted_code *= "\n" * clean_code_text
    end
    
    return extracted_code
end
```

This function uses a regular expression to match `julia` code blocks in the markdown document. It then captures the text inside the code fence and strips leading and trailing whitespace. Finally, it joins all the code blocks together with a newline character.
